intro: Argemone albiflora var. texana, commonly known as Texas prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain oily seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native range.
